abstract: As it tries to overtake General Motors as the leading global automaker by sales, Toyota’s strategy of  shifting its focus to emerging markets from the United States appears to be paying off.
snippet: As it tries to overtake General Motors as the leading global automaker by sales, Toyota’s strategy of  shifting its focus to emerging markets from the United States appears to be paying off.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO  The Toyota Motor Corporation reported on Tuesday that its profit rose 7.5 percent in the October-to-December quarter as its strategy of shifting its focus to emerging markets from the United States appears to be paying off.
